intro: Combretum antunesii, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its striking, bright red flowers that appear in clusters during the dry season. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that turn red or orange in the autumn, adding to its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. The bark is smooth and may peel in thin layers, revealing a reddish inner layer.
